author: Sophie Elsworth MoneysaverHQ deputy editor
title: Why no travel insurance leaves a holiday in tatters
text:
A DREAM holiday can quickly turn to disaster when you find yourself thousands of dollars out of pocket because you didn’t pack travel insurance.
Many travellers were recently left stranded in Bali because of a volcanic ash cloud and, for some, their insurance policies failed to cover them because of sneaky exclusions.
Diligent travellers with comprehensive cover would have had their additional out of pocket expenses reimbursed, but many were left camping at the airport.
TRAVEL: Tips you must learn before leaving home
Financial comparison website Canstar’s latest travel insurance report compared more than 200 policies from 73 insurers and quickly discovered the devil is in the detail when it comes to picking the right policy.
Don’t leave yourself up a creek without a paddle because you forgot to buy travel insurance. Source: Getty Images
Some common travel insurance exclusions are:
— High risk countries . Check the Smart Traveller website for details.
— Risky behaviour. For example being under the influence of drugs or alcohol.
— Hazardous pursuits. Scuba diving, bungee jumping and hang gliding.
— Pre-existing medical conditions. Disclosure of these conditions is important before travelling.
— Loss of items. Keep an eye on your belongings, for example don’t leave items unattended at the beach.
If you can’t afford travel insurance then you can’t afford the plane ticket either. Source: istock
And it’s certainly a case of buyer beware when choosing a travel insurance policy — the cheapest deal possible is not always the best.
Canstar’s research manager Mitchell Watson says it’s essential jetsetters pack their travel insurance before heading overseas.
“You could have an accident and end up in hospital which requires large medical bills and in certain countries the costs can be extraordinary,’’ he says.
“Once you have purchased your plane ticket your next item should be your travel insurance and if you can’t afford that then you can’t afford the plane ticket either.”
For those travelling on a shoestring, using cheaper accommodation options such as Airbnb is often popular, but comparetravelinsurance.com.au director Natalie Ball says users of these services can get caught out with insurance policies that don’t cover them.
“As long as you (and your travel partners) are not sharing your accommodation with other guests, your Airbnb dwelling would be covered as a standard hotel room,’’ she said.
“We would strongly advise those using share home accommodation to exercise a good deal of caution.”
